intro: Viguiera macrorhiza f. hassleriana, commonly known as the Hassler's blue mistflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant features a basal rosette of gray-green, fuzzy leaves and produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a drought-tolerant ornamental plant. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for pollinators and its use in xeriscaping.
